item.title: Social Lubricant
item.description: Politeness beyond the basics. Natural greetings, softening, brief social exchanges, and polite closures used in everyday Czech conversation.

item.title: Social Lubricant
item.description: The Beginning Essential greetings and polite phrases for everyday social interaction in Czech. Hello, Goodbye, Please, Thank you, Excuse me, Sorry, You're welcome, Have a nice day.

item.title: Social Lubricant
item.description: The Beginning Essential greetings and basic social exchanges for everyday interaction in Vietnamese. Hello, How are you, Names, Origin, Age, Phone number, Goodbye.

item.title: Numbers
item.description: Counting, 1â€“10, plus essential large numbers.

item.title: The Repair Kit
item.description: Stay in the Conversation Keep conversations flowing when you don't understand something. I don't understand, Can you repeat that? Can you speak more slowly? What does that mean? Do you speak English?

item.title: The Master Keys
item.description: Get What You Need Universal phrases for requesting things and expressing needs clearly. I would like this/that Do you have [x]? Where is the [x]? Can I have [x]? I need [x]. here? Please give me [x]. Please bring me [x].

item.title: Weekdays
item.description: The days of the week.

item.title: Months
item.description: The calendar year.

item.title: The Transaction
item.description: Making Purchases Essential shopping phrases for purchases, payments, and transactions. How much is this? Can I pay by card? The bill, please. I'll take it. The receipt, please. Do you have change? I'm just looking.

item.title: The Navigator
item.description: Getting Around Navigate cities with confidence: directions, transport, and locations. Where is the station? Where is the hotel? Does this go to [Place]? Please take me here. Ticket to [Place], please.

item.title: Time
item.description: Basic units of time.

item.title: Places
item.description: Vietnam and major cities.

item.title: The Quantifier
item.description: Size & Time Express time, quantity, and size: more, enough, big, small, and numbers. What time is it? At what time? Now, please. Later, Today, Tomorrow, It is big, small, I want more, That's enough, It's not enough, There are three.

item.title: Manners
item.description: Polite and culturally essential phrases for everyday interaction in Vietnam.

item.title: The Troubleshooter
item.description: Reporting Issues Report problems and issues: broken items, temperature, and mistakes. It is broken. It is cold. It is hot. It is closed. It is open. I didn't order this. There is no hot water. The key doesn't work. There is a problem here.

item.title: The Lifeline
item.description: Emergency Response Critical phrases for emergencies: medical help, police, and urgent situations. Help! Call the police! I need a doctor. Where is the hospital? I am lost. I lost my passport. I have an allergy. Don't touch me.

item.title: About
item.description:
About UtterOn

Empowering language learners through structured audio immersion.

Our Mission

UtterOn is designed to bridge the gap between textbook learning and real-world fluency. We believe that the key to mastering a language is not just memorizing rules, but training your ear and your tongue to process and produce the language naturally.

ðŸš€

Structured Path

No more guessing what to learn next. Follow our carefully curated curriculum.

ðŸŽ¯

Focus on Fluency

Our exercises prioritize speaking and listening skills from day one.

item.title: Keep it Free
item.description:
Keep UtterOn Free

Help us democratize language learning for everyone.

Why Support Us?

UtterOn is built on the belief that high-quality language education should be accessible to everyone, regardless of their financial situation. We don't charge subscriptions, we don't sell your data, and we don't clutter your experience with ads.

However, running servers, generating high-quality audio, and developing new features takes time and money. Your support helps us keep the lights on and the updates coming.
